Key Match Events: Wales and Poland played a 0-0 draw over 120 minutes, with the match ultimately decided by a penalty shootout.
Chris Mepham was sent off for a second yellow card in the final seconds of extra-time.
Daniel James' penalty was pushed away by Wojciech Szczesny, securing a win for Poland.
Wojciech Szczesny made a spectacular save to deny Kieffer Moore's looping header early in the second half.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales will not be going to Euro 2024 after Dan James missed the crucial penalty in the shootout to hand Poland victory.
Poland will now join France, the Netherlands, and Austria in Group D at Euro 2024.
Wales, meanwhile, are back in action against Slovakia on June 9, but they now have no summer tournament to look forward to.
The first nine takers in the penalty shootout all found the net before James saw his effort pushed away by Szczesny.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales created the best of the chances on the night, but were unable to find a breakthrough.
Poland struggled to carve out many opportunities for star striker Robert Lewandowski.
Wojciech Szczesny's performance will mostly be remembered for his save from James, and the Juventus shot-stopper will rightly be the toast of Poland this evening.
Daniel James has never let his country down and is enjoying a fine season for Leeds United as they eye promotion back to the Premier League.
